Pope John Paul II passed away on 2 April 2005 after a long illness, a fact confirmed by the Vatican. There were 42 cardinals present who confirmed the pope's death. The official cause of death was heart failure and pneumonia, and was not due to the assassination attempt of 13 March 1981.
